synsets.definition: A state of emotional balance where internal feelings remain stable and consistent without extreme fluctuations
Classical concept of emotional tranquility characterized by freedom from disturbance and maintained inner calm
Chinese concept of maintaining emotional centeredness through regulated heart-mind alignment and balanced qi flow
Japanese notion of peaceful heart-mind state achieved through emotional harmony and social balance
Korean concept of comfortable heart-mind state characterized by emotional ease and internal settling
Sanskrit term for one whose wisdom remains steady; emotional stability through consistent understanding and awareness
Sanskrit concept of mental evenness and emotional balance, maintaining equal disposition toward all experiences
Arabic concept of deep tranquility combined with confident assurance; emotional stability through trust
Arabic term for divinely-inspired tranquility that brings emotional stability and inner peace
Persian concept of gentle, restful peace characterized by emotional ease and comfortable stability
Hebrew concept of soul's rest; deep emotional tranquility achieved through spiritual alignment and inner peace
African philosophy-derived emotional balance achieved through harmonious relationships and community connection
Zulu-derived concept of emotional unity and shared peaceful state within community context
Native American concept of emotional balance achieved through alignment with natural cycles and spiritual directions
Lakota concept of emotional stability through recognition of interconnectedness with all living beings
Aboriginal Australian concept of quiet, contemplative awareness that brings deep emotional stability
Spanish concept of emotional equanimity characterized by balanced temperament and stable reactions
Portuguese concept of peaceful quietude and gentle stillness that provides emotional stability
German mystical concept of emotional tranquility achieved through letting go and surrendered acceptance
Swedish-inspired emotional state of 'just right' balance; contentment through moderation and sufficiency
Maintaining emotional stability through consistent internal alignment and balanced responsiveness
To bring one's emotional state into balance and maintain steady, consistent affective responses
Psychological process of maintaining emotional balance through natural regulatory mechanisms
Consistent emotional baseline characterized by stability and predictable, balanced responses
Maintained emotional stability and self-control, especially during challenging or stressful situations
Nautical metaphor for emotional stability; maintaining steady progress through varying conditions
